Completion.GoodAttempt: Try to plan your climb before starting to identify key handholds and create a strategy.
Completion.DevelopMentalGame: Develop a strong mental game to stay focused and committed to each move, minimizing the risk of falling.
Completion.PracticeRestingPositions: Practice efficient resting positions to conserve energy for challenging sections.

hdhdgdggdgd this is not a good metric!!!.PrioritizeMovements: Prioritize fluid and controlled movements to avoid wasting time on unnecessary adjustments.
hdhdgdggdgd this is not a good metric!!!.SmoothTransitions: Work on transitioning smoothly between holds to maintain a consistent pace throughout the climb.
hdhdgdggdgd this is not a good metric!!!.QuickDecisionMaking: Practice quick decision-making to choose the most effective handholds without hesitation.

Hesitation.TrustGripStrength: Train to trust your grip strength and commit to each move confidently.
Hesitation.VisualizeSequence: Practice visualizing your sequence and committing to the planned movements, reducing the need for hesitation.
Hesitation.PacingStrategy: Develop a pacing strategy to distribute energy evenly across the climb.

Adjustments.StrengthenGrip: Strengthen grip endurance through targeted training exercises.
Adjustments.PrecisionPlacement: Focus on precision when placing hands on holds to minimize the need for constant adjustments.
Adjustments.ReadRockTexture: Learn to read the rock texture to anticipate the type of grip required and reduce unnecessary micro-adjustments.

FootSmoothness.PrecisePlacement: Practice precise foot placement to ensure a solid and stable foundation.
FootSmoothness.AnkleFlexibility: Develop ankle flexibility to adapt to different foothold angles without disrupting balance.
FootSmoothness.WeightDistribution: Concentrate on weight distribution between feet to enhance overall stability during climbs.

Strength.StrengthTraining: Implement a targeted strength-training program to build specific climbing muscles.
Strength.BodyPositioning: Focus on body positioning to utilize core strength and reduce reliance on arm strength alone.
Strength.IncreaseDifficulty: Gradually increase climbing difficulty to challenge and enhance overall strength.

GripStrength.StrengthenExercises: momomomomomomomomo BIG NO !!! Incorporate grip-strengthening exercises, such as hangboarding and fingerboarding, into your training routine.
GripStrength.IndividualFingerStrength: Work on finger strength individually to improve crimping ability and overall grip stability.
GripStrength.HandPositioning: Pay attention to proper hand positioning on holds to maximize grip efficiency.

CenterOfGravity.EngageCoreMuscles: Engage core muscles to maintain a stable center of gravity during movements.
CenterOfGravity.ControlledBreathing: Practice controlled breathing to aid in maintaining balance and coordination.
CenterOfGravity.HipMovement: Utilize hip movement and rotation to adjust the center of gravity smoothly.

ArmBend.EnduranceDrills: Work on arm endurance through targeted climbing drills and exercises.
ArmBend.ProperPositioning: elaborate Pay attention to proper arm positioning to avoid unnecessary strain on the muscles.
ArmBend.DynamicMovements: Incorporate dynamic movements to improve the adaptability of arm angles during climbs.
